popt4jlib.MSSC

Interface ClustererIntf

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DetAnnealClusterer, GMeansMTClusterer, NeuralGasMTClusterer

    public interface ClustererIntf
    The interface every class implementing algorithms for MSSC clustering should obey.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAllVectors(java.util.Vector docs)
      adds a set of VectorIntf vectors to the current set of vectors to be later clustered (via a call to clusterVectors().
      void addVector(VectorIntf d)
      adds a VectorIntf to the set of vectors to be later clustered.
      java.util.Vector clusterVectors()
      cluster the document vectors and return the Vector with the cluster centers.
      double eval(EvaluatorIntf ev)
      evaluate the current clustering according to the EvaluatorIntf passed in.
      int[] getClusterCards()
      return an array of size equal to centers.size(), showing for each cluster i, the number of documents assigned to it.
      int[] getClusteringIndices()
      return the clustering as a partition.
      java.util.Vector getCurrentCenters()
      returns current centers.
      java.util.Vector getCurrentVectors()
      returns current vectors to be clustered.
      java.util.Vector getIntermediateClusters()
      return in a Vector some or all of the clusters produced during the run of the clustering algorithm.
      java.util.Hashtable getParams()
      returns the set of parameters to be used in the clustering process.
      void reset()
      reset for next use.
      void setClusteringIndices(int[] asgn)
      set the ClustererIntf asgnmnt indices to the specified array.
      void setInitialClustering(java.util.Vector centers)
      sets the initial centers to be used by the clusterer in the clustering process.
      void setParams(java.util.Hashtable params)
      sets parameters for the clusterer to use when clustering (eg the termination criteria to be used).

    • Method Detail

      • addVector

        void addVector(VectorIntf d)
               throws ClustererException
        adds a VectorIntf to the set of vectors to be later clustered.
        Parameters:
        d - VectorIntf
        Throws:
        ClustererException

      • addAllVectors

        void addAllVectors(java.util.Vector docs)
        adds a set of VectorIntf vectors to the current set of vectors to be later clustered (via a call to clusterVectors().
        Parameters:
        docs - Vector Vector

      • setParams

        void setParams(java.util.Hashtable params)
        sets parameters for the clusterer to use when clustering (eg the termination criteria to be used).
        Parameters:
        params - Hashtable

      • getParams

        java.util.Hashtable getParams()
        returns the set of parameters to be used in the clustering process.
        Returns:
        Hashtable Map

      • setInitialClustering

        void setInitialClustering(java.util.Vector centers)
                          throws ClustererException
        sets the initial centers to be used by the clusterer in the clustering process. This call also defines the number of clusters sought.
        Parameters:
        centers - Vector Vector
        Throws:
        ClustererException - if the argument is empty or null or contains objects that are not VectorIntf objects or if the dimensions don't agree.

      • reset

        void reset()
        reset for next use.

      • getCurrentCenters

        java.util.Vector getCurrentCenters()
        returns current centers. Maybe non responsive from other threads while the clustering process is running (eg synchronized)
        Returns:
        Vector Vector

      • getCurrentVectors

        java.util.Vector getCurrentVectors()
        returns current vectors to be clustered. Maybe non responsive from other threads while the clustering process is running (eg synchronized)
        Returns:
        Vector Vector

      • clusterVectors

        java.util.Vector clusterVectors()
                                throws ClustererException
        cluster the document vectors and return the Vector with the cluster centers.
        Returns:
        Vector
        Throws:
        ClustererException

      • getClusteringIndices

        int[] getClusteringIndices()
                           throws ClustererException
        return the clustering as a partition. Must be called after clusterVectors().
        Returns:
        int[] an array of size=all docs entered, array values in [1...centers.size()]
        Throws:
        ClustererException

      • setClusteringIndices

        void setClusteringIndices(int[] asgn)
                          throws ClustererException
        set the ClustererIntf asgnmnt indices to the specified array. Should not throw even if null array is passed in.
        Parameters:
        asgn - int[]
        Throws:
        ClustererException

      • getClusterCards

        int[] getClusterCards()
                      throws ClustererException
        return an array of size equal to centers.size(), showing for each cluster i, the number of documents assigned to it. Throws if clusterVectors() has not been called.
        Returns:
        int[]
        Throws:
        ClustererException

      • eval

        double eval(EvaluatorIntf ev)
            throws ClustererException
        evaluate the current clustering according to the EvaluatorIntf passed in.
        Parameters:
        ev - EvaluatorIntf
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        ClustererException

      • getIntermediateClusters

        java.util.Vector getIntermediateClusters()
                                         throws ClustererException
        return in a Vector some or all of the clusters produced during the run of the clustering algorithm. May also choose to throw an exception instead, so any calling code must guard for ClustererException
        Returns:
        Vector Vector
        Throws:
        ClustererException
